alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Coos County through 215 PM EDT... At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Pittsburg, or 12 miles north of Colebrook, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsburg and Clarksville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
